trans-unit.source: Update Index
trans-unit.target: Update Index

trans-unit.source: Update Index (Azure Search Service REST API)
trans-unit.target: Update Index (Azure Search Service REST API)

trans-unit.source: You can update an existing index within Azure Search using an HTTP PUT request.
trans-unit.target: You can update an existing index within Azure Search using an HTTP PUT request.

trans-unit.source: Updates can include adding new fields to the existing schema, modifying CORS options, and modifying scoring profiles (see <link xlink:href="719b924e-6d8a-43c1-b7b0-827487020e3a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Add scoring profiles to a search index (Azure Search API)</link> for more information).
trans-unit.target: Updates can include adding new fields to the existing schema, modifying CORS options, and modifying scoring profiles (see <link xlink:href="719b924e-6d8a-43c1-b7b0-827487020e3a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Add scoring profiles to a search index (Azure Search API)</link> for more information).

trans-unit.source: You can specify the name of the index to update on the request URI.
trans-unit.target: You can specify the name of the index to update on the request URI.

trans-unit.source: Support for index schema updates is limited to operations that don't require rebuilding the search index.
trans-unit.target: Support for index schema updates is limited to operations that don't require rebuilding the search index.

trans-unit.source: Any changes that require re-indexing, such as changing field types, are not currently supported.
trans-unit.target: Any changes that require re-indexing, such as changing field types, are not currently supported.

trans-unit.source: New fields can be added at any time, although existing fields cannot be changed or deleted.
trans-unit.target: New fields can be added at any time, although existing fields cannot be changed or deleted.

trans-unit.source: The same applies to <languageKeyword>suggesters</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: The same applies to <languageKeyword>suggesters</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: New fields may be added to <languageKeyword>suggesters</languageKeyword> at the time the fields are added, but fields cannot be removed from <languageKeyword>suggesters</languageKeyword> and existing fields cannot be added.
trans-unit.target: New fields may be added to <languageKeyword>suggesters</languageKeyword> at the time the fields are added, but fields cannot be removed from <languageKeyword>suggesters</languageKeyword> and existing fields cannot be added.

trans-unit.source: For more information on <languageKeyword>suggesters</languageKeyword>, see <link xlink:href="ecafed05-c746-4d9e-ac8e-653066e909b5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Index (Azure Search Service REST API)</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on <languageKeyword>suggesters</languageKeyword>, see <link xlink:href="ecafed05-c746-4d9e-ac8e-653066e909b5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Index (Azure Search Service REST API)</link>.

trans-unit.source: When adding a new field to an index, all existing documents in the index be automatically have a null value for that field.
trans-unit.target: When adding a new field to an index, all existing documents in the index be automatically have a null value for that field.

trans-unit.source: No additional storage space will be consumed until new documents are added to the index.
trans-unit.target: No additional storage space will be consumed until new documents are added to the index.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: HTTPS is required for all service requests.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS is required for all service requests.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Update Index</languageKeyword> request is constructed using HTTP PUT.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Update Index</languageKeyword> request is constructed using HTTP PUT.

trans-unit.source: With PUT, the index name is part of the URL.
trans-unit.target: With PUT, the index name is part of the URL.

trans-unit.source: If the index doesn't exist, it is created.
trans-unit.target: If the index doesn't exist, it is created.

trans-unit.source: If it already exists, it is updated to the new definition.
trans-unit.target: If it already exists, it is updated to the new definition.

trans-unit.source: The index name must be lower case, start with a letter or number, have no slashes or dots, and be less than 128 characters.
trans-unit.target: The index name must be lower case, start with a letter or number, have no slashes or dots, and be less than 128 characters.

trans-unit.source: After starting the index name with a letter or number, the rest of the name can include any letter, number and dashes, as long as the dashes are not consecutive.
trans-unit.target: After starting the index name with a letter or number, the rest of the name can include any letter, number and dashes, as long as the dashes are not consecutive.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>api-version</codeInline> parameter is required.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>api-version</codeInline> parameter is required.

trans-unit.source: The current version is <codeInline>api-version=2015-02-28</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The current version is <codeInline>api-version=2015-02-28</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="62ffee0b-ae3b-46c1-9ddb-a372d21c6f4d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versions of the Azure Search Service REST API</link> for details and alternative versions.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="62ffee0b-ae3b-46c1-9ddb-a372d21c6f4d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versions of the Azure Search Service REST API</link> for details and alternative versions.

trans-unit.source: Request Headers
trans-unit.target: Request Headers

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the required and optional request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the required and optional request headers.

trans-unit.source: Request Header
trans-unit.target: Request Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Set this to <codeInline>application/json</codeInline>
trans-unit.target: Set this to <codeInline>application/json</codeInline>

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> is used to authenticate the request to your Search service.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> is used to authenticate the request to your Search service.

trans-unit.source: It is a string value, unique to your service.
trans-unit.target: It is a string value, unique to your service.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Update Index</languageKeyword> request must include an <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> header set to your admin key (as opposed to a query key).
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Update Index</languageKeyword> request must include an <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> header set to your admin key (as opposed to a query key).

trans-unit.source: You will also need the service name to construct the request URL.
trans-unit.target: You will also need the service name to construct the request URL.

trans-unit.source: You can get the service name and <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> from your service dashboard in the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can get the service name and <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> from your service dashboard in the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: See <externalLink><linkText>Create an Azure Search service in the portal</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/search-create-service-portal/</linkUri></externalLink> for page navigation help.
trans-unit.target: See <externalLink><linkText>Create an Azure Search service in the portal</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/search-create-service-portal/</linkUri></externalLink> for page navigation help.

trans-unit.source: Request Body Syntax
trans-unit.target: Request Body Syntax

trans-unit.source: When updating an existing index, the body must include the original schema definition, plus the new fields you are adding, as well as the modified scoring profiles and CORS options, if any.
trans-unit.target: When updating an existing index, the body must include the original schema definition, plus the new fields you are adding, as well as the modified scoring profiles and CORS options, if any.

trans-unit.source: If you are not modifying the scoring profiles and CORS options, you must include the original values from when the index was created.
trans-unit.target: If you are not modifying the scoring profiles and CORS options, you must include the original values from when the index was created.

trans-unit.source: In general, the best pattern to use for updates is to retrieve the index definition with a GET, modify it, and then update it with PUT.
trans-unit.target: In general, the best pattern to use for updates is to retrieve the index definition with a GET, modify it, and then update it with PUT.

trans-unit.source: The schema syntax used to create an index is reproduced here for convenience.
trans-unit.target: The schema syntax used to create an index is reproduced here for convenience.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="ecafed05-c746-4d9e-ac8e-653066e909b5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Index (Azure Search API)</link> for more details.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="ecafed05-c746-4d9e-ac8e-653066e909b5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Index (Azure Search API)</link> for more details.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: For a successful request, you should see "204 No Content".
trans-unit.target: For a successful request, you should see "204 No Content".

trans-unit.source: By default the response body will be empty.
trans-unit.target: By default the response body will be empty.

trans-unit.source: However, if the <codeInline>Prefer</codeInline> request header is set to <codeInline>return=representation</codeInline>, the response body will contain the JSON for the index definition that was updated.
trans-unit.target: However, if the <codeInline>Prefer</codeInline> request header is set to <codeInline>return=representation</codeInline>, the response body will contain the JSON for the index definition that was updated.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the success status code will be "200 OK.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the success status code will be "200 OK.

trans-unit.source: Azure Search .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Azure Search .NET SDK
